Authors: Nicolas Magain, Emmanuel SÃ©rusiaux, Bernard Goffinet
Title:
Further photomorphs in the lichen family Lobariaceae from
Reunion (Mascarene archipelago) with notes on the phylogeny of
Dendriscocaulon cyanomorphs
Keywords:
Peltigerales, Lobaria discolor, Sticta dichotoma,
phylogeny
Abstract:
Two new photomorphs in the Lobariaceae have been found on
the remote island of Reunion in the Mascarene archipelago: the
free-living Dendriscocaulon-like cyanomorph of the pantropical Lobaria
discolor, and the cyanomorph of Sticta dichotoma, a species apparently
endemic to the western parts of the Indian Ocean, known only from its
chloromorph. Inferences from three loci demonstrate that the fungus
involved in each morph of either pair belongs to the same species.
Phylogenetic analyses resolve all genera of the Lobariaceae as
polyphyletic, and all Dendriscocaulon-like cyanomorphs within Lobaria,
except for D. dendroides, which belongs to Sticta.
